I will say I very rarely use an actual computer when looking at websites so I can say there is some weird sizing things on mobile

On your home page none of the pictures fill up the black box:

Screenshot_20250704-2024061080×2460 92.6 KB

On your team history page the robots are either oddly cut off or when explaining the game as small as physically possible

Screenshot_20250704-2024561080×2460 78.2 KB

Screenshot_20250704-2025091080×2460 163 KB

In your about us page the YouTube video is oddly cropped as well

Screenshot_20250704-2025451080×2460 388 KB

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-07-05T02:18:32.657Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":229,"readers_count":228,"score":130.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503935,"topic_slug":"how-can-i-improve-my-teams-website","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":57904,"username":"stephen.ostermiller","name":"Stephen Ostermiller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stephen.ostermiller/{size}/188076_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67275,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"(He/They) (Team 236)"},"post_url":"/t/how-can-i-improve-my-teams-website/503935/7","custom_user_title":"(He/They) (Team 236)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3674704,"name":"Yehudan Rothstein","username":"Yehuda","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yehuda/{size}/265645_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-05T19:15:49.921Z","cooked":"

Hey, last year I was head of the “web” in my team, some of my projects are linked here:
FRC Team website - https://www.excaliburfrc.com/
Our code library docs - https://excalib.excaliburfrc.com/
Our scouting system - https://scouting.excaliburfrc.com/
and more, like a finance management system or strategy dashboard.

I found the best way to make your website “elegant” and “nice” is by generating a layout from AI tools.

I looked at your website, and it’s an awesome way to start - but getting to a perfect product is very hard and takes a lot of experience and time. So, for your case, I would work with ChatGPT for making a detailed prompt for your website structure and layout, then giving it to a website generating model like Bolt or Lovable - they do a fantastic job at creating websites that look nice and have really good “visual context”.

Notice that they often use languages and frameworks like TS, node, vite, and tailwind - that are not just plain HTML, CSS, and JS. This does require learning and\or having experience to edit them (I guess you don’t want just to vibe code it ).

If you need any assistance, you can personally contact me on chief (or via out teams email) and I will gladly help with whatever you need.

if you are looking for new things to add to you website. I recomend that you look some other teams websites (like 1678, 4481 or 6328) and see what they did and just get a littel of inspiration from them and make it the way you would like to have it.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-07-06T19:09:03.162Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":90.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503935,"topic_slug":"how-can-i-improve-my-teams-website","display_username":"Eli","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70518,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I like robots"},"post_url":"/t/how-can-i-improve-my-teams-website/503935/9","custom_user_title":"I like robots","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3675396,"name":"Gavin","username":"Gavin0","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gavin0/{size}/193252_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-06T20:23:53.804Z","cooked":"

On that note, If you’re ever looking for inspiration like I was, the best FRC team website I’ve seen is probably 245, Adambots

I do think design is really only 50% of the role here, with actual maintenance and wiriting/photos worth spending time viewing being the other half, but thats deviating from the topic a little.

Good luck! I love to see cool team websites

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-07-06T20:23:53.804Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503935,"topic_slug":"how-can-i-improve-my-teams-website","display_username":"Gavin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.adambots.com/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"AdamBots FRC & OCCRA Team 245","clicks":28}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70518,"username":"Eli_was_taken","name":"Eli","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eli_was_taken/{size}/241762_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59177,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1189 Team Captain & Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/how-can-i-improve-my-teams-website/503935/10","custom_user_title":"1189 Team Captain & Programmer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3675449,"name":"Aidan","username":"Aidunlin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aidunlin/{size}/234758_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-06T22:58:12.942Z","cooked":"

Like others are saying, definitely test your website using browser inspector tools. I’d try it out on both Firefox and Chrome, and Safari if you have access to a Mac/Macbook. (While I use Firefox as my daily browser, I use Chrome for web-dev as it has better tooling.)

Still, there’s a TON of useful tools in any browser. In the Network tool, you can see the size of every single resource that your browser receives on page load. The Robot Archive page is particularly egregious: it’s pulling 170 MB due to all of those embedded Google Slides.

image1024×616 102 KB

I would try replacing those with a button and a smaller, compressed copy of an image of each robot. Once you click the button, it will “summon” that particular Google Slides embed in the page. This will require some JavaScript.

Here’s another method: add the loading="lazy" attribute to each <iframe> tag. This will defer loading the iframe until it’s scrolled into view. This is automatically done by the browser: no JavaScript required.

One more suggestion: keep large paragraphs (and lists) justified left, and cap their maximum width. This makes it easier to read.

Good work so far!

In super non-technical terms (my coding knowledge comes from a book published in 2017 and Chat GPT), how would I go about capping their maximum width while effectively using different screen sizes? (so not just putting a big old margin next to it like I normally do)

This comment has a bunch of good and knowledgeable feedback. I should probably look into using a framework as it would probably fix a lot of my issues, but that might be farther out in the future because my knowledge of coding is not very good . In terms of vibecoding it, I’ve used the AI model DeepSite a little bit no, I’ve gotta say I’ve not been thrilled with its results because it loves writing code that I have no clue how to read. (Really, having a Bajillion CSS attributes for one button is a little over the top for what I need. ) Anyway, the general comment is that it probably needs to be rewritten and something slightly more elegant, and that’s not off the table, that just might be a little while.

Here’s a good place to start with lazy loading:

(edit: forced link to be in English)

web.dev

It's time to lazy-load offscreen iframes!  |  Articles...

This post covers the loading attribute and how to use it to control the loading of iframes.

As for maximum width, go learn about the difference between the CSS attributes, width and max-width:

w3schools.com

W3Schools.com

W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

I recommend those two sites, as well as MDN’s Web Docs, for all your basic HTML/CSS/JS documentation needs:

MDN Web Docs

MDN Web Docs

The MDN Web Docs site provides information about Open Web technologies including HTML, CSS, and APIs for both Web sites and progressive web apps.
